abstract: In a phase III clinical trial, previously untreated patients with acute myeloid leukemia and FLT3 mutations received either the FLT3 inhibitor midostaurin or a placebo during chemotherapy. Patients who received midostaurin had a 5-year survival rate of 50.9% compared with 43.9% for the placebo group, as well as remissions that lasted nearly a year longer.
title: Midostaurin + Chemo Ups AML Survival.
